v0.1.2.description:
First release by me (@1313e) that is mostly a stability patch.

**Issues fixed:**
- Connection and stability issues: 
  - You can now open and connect the client whenever you feel like, even if the game is not running at all yet.
  - Client can detect easily when it lost connection and will restore it once able to.
  - Full-screen and tabbing in/out works correctly now.
  - Client will now also tell you when it has no connection to the game.
- Fixed several typos in internal names that caused some technologies to not be obtainable.


**Improvements:**
- With the connection issues resolved, the delay between checking a location and receiving the corresponding item is heavily reduced (almost instant).


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/commits/v0.1.2
v0.1.2.title: v0.1.2

v0.1.3.description:
**Fixes:**

- Make sure to properly detect when the game is not running to skip the full event loop.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.1.2...v0.1.3
v0.1.3.title: v0.1.3

v0.1.4.description:
**Fixes:**

- Mimic FireTuner's connection behavior to properly clean up connection ports when connecting to Civ V.
- Civ V Client can now detect when Civ V is running and is connected without the AP Mod being loaded.
- Improved behavior when disconnecting and connecting the client again.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.1.3...v0.1.4
v0.1.4.title: v0.1.4

v0.2.0.description:
NOTE: The APMod was also updated in this release, so please make sure to use the new version.

**General**:
- Refactored the entire code base (both APWorld and APMod) to follow a modular fashion, allowing me to implement new features much more rapidly now.

**Changes/Improvements**:
- Items and locations now have their type prefixed to their names (this is mostly for future updates where I can add more types besides just technologies, without causing name clashing).
- Some small logic that was still remaining has now been removed entirely as it was faulty.
- The client now has a proper description in the AP Launcher. :)
- Some changes were made to the logs of the client that allows me to more easily debug issues if they arise.
- Reduced amount of pointless communication between the game and the client to basically zero, reducing desync chances and improving responsiveness.
    - The only desync issue that still persists is when you tab out of the game; wait for a while (I believe at least 5 minutes); close the client; tab back into the game; start up the client again. The game will refuse to connect and the only way to make it connect is to go back to the main menu and load the game again.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.1.4...v0.2.0
v0.2.0.title: APWorld v0.2.0 + APMod v3

v0.2.1.description:
NOTE: The APMod was also updated in this release, so please make sure to use the new version.

**General**:
- Refactored the communication system from pull (client asks game what its current state is and decides what that implies) to push (game tells client any time it does something relevant). This allows for far more efficient communication.

**Changes/Improvements**:
- Reduced the delay between sending a location and receiving an item to about a second. Cannot reduce it much further without the game acting up, so probably going to leave it here.
- Items are now resynced upon loading a game (either starting a new one or reloading a save file).
- Locations that you did already in the multiworld are automatically marked as done upon loading a game.
  NOTE: I have not figured out yet how to get rid of the popup for granting technologies, so if you have done 60 techs already, be prepared to click a lot.
- All AP techs now have a (somewhat badly scaled) AP icon instead of the Agriculture icon. I will replace it with a proper icon later, but I really wanted to get rid of the Agriculture icon.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.2.0...v0.2.1
v0.2.1.title: APWorld v0.2.1 + APMod v4

v0.3.0.description:
NOTE: The APMod was also updated in this release, so please make sure to use the new version.

**General**:
- Progressive eras! \o/

**Changes/Improvements**:
- All researchable technologies in the game now require their respective era to be unlocked.
- Eras are unlocked by a new progressive era item. These items appear in the tech tree as disabled technologies, meaning that you cannot research them yourself. They can only be unlocked by outside influence. As disabled technologies are red, it is also easy to see up to what era is unlocked now.
- All technologies are now isolated within their own era. Requirements of technologies based on previous eras no longer exist (but they do within the era itself).
  So, for example, if in vanilla a Classical tech requires an Ancient tech, their AP counterparts will not.
  However, if in vanilla an Ancient tech requires an earlier Ancient tech, then their AP counterparts do as well.
- The above means that AP techs can be researched out of order if you so wish, assuming you have the proper era unlocked. This was done on purpose to make it much less of a hassle to check a location (tech in this case) that someone for example hinted.
- 7 new AP technologies were added to the location pool (one for each era that is not Information) to make up for the 7 added progressive eras. They have the same cost as the first tech normally in that era. These might be removed later on when I have added more location types.
- A new option was added to the YAML where you can specify which era must be unlocked before the game is considered beatable. Default is Information Era (receive all 7 Progressive Era items).

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.2.1...v0.3.0
v0.3.0.title: APWorld v0.3.0 + APMod v5

v0.3.1.description:
**Fixes**:
- Make sure that multiple of the same item can be received by the player at once.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.3.0...v0.3.1
v0.3.1.title: APWorld v0.3.1

v0.4.0.description:
NOTE: The APMod was also updated in this release, so please make sure to use the new version.

**General**:
- Progressive techs! \o/

**Changes/Improvements**:
- Added an option to use progressive tech items instead of the normal tech items.
- When enabled, all 79 technologies in the game (all but Agriculture, which is always unlocked at the start) are divided into 11 categories.
- When you get a progressive item of one of those 11 categories, you get the next technology in that category.
- The first 10 categories are based on number increasing (growth; production; science; culture; gold; happiness); exploration (its own category) and combat (melee; ranged; siege).
- The 11th category is a Misc category that contains technologies that do not fit anywhere else really. Example are The Wheel and Atomic Theory.
- NOTE: Technologies were divided into these categories based on what I felt like that tech is most responsible for. Many techs could apply to multiple categories, in which case I picked the one I felt it belonged the most to. If you have a suggestion for a change (either moving a tech to a different category or changing the categories altogether), please let me know on Discord (@1313e).

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.3.1...v0.4.0
v0.4.0.title: APWorld v0.4.0 + APMod v6

v0.5.0.description:
NOTE: The APMod was also updated in this release, so please make sure to use the new version.

**General**:
- Social policy locations
- Natural Wonder sanity
- World Wonder sanity
- Filler items
- Trap items

**Changes/Improvements**:
- The social policies of the 9 normal policy branches are now locations. Each branch has 7 locations (adopting the branch; the 5 policies; finishing the branch).
- One policy branch is unlocked each era, with the exception of the Information Era, which unlocks two branches.
- Policy costs rising has been reduced.
- All AP techs were renamed to mention the name of the era they belong to in their names.
- Natural and world wonder sanity options: Add all natural and/or world wonders to your game as locations.
  NOTE: Do NOT use World Wonder sanity in a sync, as it can require you to build late-game wonders early, or build wonders that the AI will build early.
- Various filler items have been added. These range from simply giving you some gold to starting golden ages or permanently increasing happiness per city.
- Traps have been added. Currently, the traps we have are reducing your gold; culture; faith by an amount or a random civilization declaring a war on you.
- Added options in the YAML to toggle traps; blacklist specific traps from ever appearing; and setting the chance that a filler item is a trap item instead.
- Filler and trap items use internal weights that determine how likely they are to appear. Lesser damaging/yielding ones are more likely to appear. For traps, the more damaging ones drop significantly faster in weight than the more beneficial filler items do.

**Fixes**:
- All technologies required for Science Victory are now in Progressive Science.
- Progressive Era items are now the only way to advance through eras.


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.4.0...v0.5.0
v0.5.0.title: APWorld v0.5.0 + APMod v7

v0.6.0.description:
NOTE: The APMod was also updated in this release, so please make sure to use the new version.

**General**:
- Victory goal logic

**Changes/Improvements**:
- The Science; Culture; and Diplomatic victory goals now have optional logic associated with them.
- In the YAML, one can specify one of these three victories as their main goal for the AP. This adds all items required to achieve that goal to be required for the AP.
- Domination and Time are absent as Domination can be achieved at any given moment and Time has no requirements.
- Note that this solely affects victory logic. You can still achieve a different victory than selected or achieve it earlier than logic expects you to.
- Added a few more filler and trap items.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.5.0...v0.6.0
v0.6.0.title: APWorld v0.6.0 + APMod v8

v0.6.1.description:
**Fixes**:
- Make sure to properly disable trap items if a player has traps enabled but all of them are blacklisted.
- Do not in-place modify the requirements dicts when creating access rules. Instead, create copies.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.6.0...v0.6.1
v0.6.1.title: APWorld v0.6.1

v0.6.2.description:
NOTE: The APMod was also updated in this release, so please make sure to use the new version.

**Changes/Improvements**:
- Policy costs increase rate is now 5% slower.

**Fixes**:
- Batch granting of social policies and techs to avoid overloading Civ V with very large requests.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.6.1...v0.6.2
v0.6.2.title: APWorld v0.6.2 + APMod v9

v0.6.3.description:
NOTE: The APMod was also updated in this release, so please make sure to use the new version.

**Changes**:
- Trap names are now automatically added to the description of the trap blacklist option.
- Force turn on the option to allow policy saving to prevent them from softlocking the game.

**Fixes**:
- Fixed an issue where being granted a free social policy would softlock the game if you cannot adopt anything. Now, the free social policy is removed from the player and granted back once you are able to adopt policies again.
- Fixed an issue with world wonder sanity logic where the 9 policy branch wonders had the incorrect requirements.
- Fixed an issue where capturing a city would not properly grant all world wonders in that city as checks.
  NOTE: Logic does not account for the player capturing cities for world wonder locations, as otherwise ALL world wonders would be in logic immediately (as technically all world wonders can be built by your enemies and you can technically capture their cities at any moment).

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.6.2...v0.6.3
v0.6.3.title: APWorld v0.6.3 + APMod v10

v0.6.4.description:
**Fixes**:
- Fixed a logic issue where the requirement for training Archeologists (Writing + Education) was not part of the requirements for a Culture victory.
- Fixed a logic issue where National College had Progressive Misc 1 instead of Progressive Misc 2 as its requirement.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.6.3...v0.6.4
v0.6.4.title: APWorld v0.6.4

v0.7.1.description:
**General**:
- Locations logic

**Changes/Improvements**:
- All technology and policy locations past Ancient Era now logically require one or more buildings to be buildable. Note that this only affects logic. The game itself does not block you from checking those locations.
- Added the "Embarking Goal Logic" option. When set to True, the technologies Optics (enables embarking) and Astronomy (enables ocean embarking) are logically required to beat the game. Similarly to the above, this only affects logic.
- The "Progressive Exploration" item has been renamed to "Progressive Navy", which now contains 9 technologies instead of the 4 it used to have. The first 4 are exploration (over water) related; whereas the other 5 unlock naval units.
- Added a new filler item named "Snack from Thes". This item gives you 200 Gold; 200 Culture; and 100 Faith. Unlike all other items in the game, this one breaks naming convention and instead is named after my sister, who requested an item to be named after her. It has a higher chance of appearing compared to other filler items of the same value.
- Added an overview of all logic related rules that are hidden in the APWorld to the README, including the changes made in this release.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.6.4...v0.7.1
v0.7.1.title: APWorld v0.7.1

v0.8.0.description:
NOTE: Several new options were added, so the YAML template needs to be regenerated.
NOTE2: The AP Mod is no longer needed as this release creates its own mod versions. Please remove the old AP Mod from Civ V.

**General**:
- Patch files with slot-specific mod versions
- Item hints

**Changes/Improvements**:
- Manifest file was added for compatibility with AP 0.7+
- `items.py` and `locations.py` were split into proper subpackages. This improves maintainability and readability.
- Cleaned up the way progressive items are defined, heavily reducing code complexity.
  - Progression items can now define that they belong to a progressive item (like how technologies are also part of a progressive technology).
  - Progressive items can now define that they should be used under specific circumstances, like an option being toggled on.
  - Progression items are only included in the item pool if none of their progressive parents are included. Each progression item can still only be included in the pool once this way.
  - Item requirements now only have to specify a progression item as their requirement. If they belong to a progressive item, the item requirements access rule will automatically take that into account now.
- The APWorld now generates an output/patch file when generating a seed:
  - This patch file contains a version of the AP Mod unique to this slot.
  - When playing on a specific seed, all you need to do now is open the patch file belonging to that seed. The file takes care of everything else, like installing that mod; opening the Civ V Client; connecting to the correct server; etc.
  - Once in Civ V, enable the mod that was installed for you and you can start playing your slot.
- With the new slot-specific mod versions, also enabled the following features:
  - Policy and technology costs can now be modified in the YAML.
  - Locations can now have hints what item it will send.
  - Loading a save file or mod not related to the connected slot will now stop the client from working. This avoids sending checks by accident from unrelated save files; or enabling an AP Mod version from a different slot.

**Fixes**:
- Policy cost modifier is now applied to the Palace instead of each policy. This should fix the issue with culture (costs) underflowing.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.7.1...v0.8.0
v0.8.0.title: APWorld v0.8.0

v0.9.0.description:
NOTE: Several new options were added, so the YAML template needs to be regenerated.

**General**:
- Buildingsanity
- Item hints for all sanities

**Changes/Improvements**:
- Refrigeration and Radar were added to Culture victory requirements.
- Ecology was added to Science victory requirements.
- If an item is for the player itself, the full item hint will now state `"Your <item>"` instead of `"<player_name>'s <item>"`.
- Added buildingsanity: The 53 standard buildings can be added to the location pool.
- All buildings that are part of a sanity (building; national wonder; world wonder) now will have item hints in their names and descriptions according to the item hint option, if their corresponding sanity is turned on.
- Palace now yields much more than normal to make early game not as tedious when you cannot unlock specific crucial techs immediately (looking at you, Mining and Calendar). Note that these changes are universal. Your opponents get them as well.

**Fixes**:
- Single quotes are no longer duplicated (by Civ V) when updating databases. Instead, I have gone for a different approach and fully recreate the databases (which works for some reason, but updating does not).

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/1313e/Civ-V-AP-World/compare/v0.8.2...v0.9.0
v0.9.0.title: APWorld v0.9.0

v0.9.1.description:

v0.9.2.description:
